poem:
**Tariffs and Toll**

In the heart of neutrality,  
a tremor shakes the Alps—  
echoes of a call,  
stumbled words lead to  
an avalanche of debt.  
Pride distilled into Swiss watches,  
cheese, and chocolate  
ticking away in silent revolt.  
A world bound in tariffs,  
where even mountains must bow  
to the unpredictable winds of power.
